roleset.name: having import
roleset.note: CONSEQUENTIAL-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. (from consequential.01-j)

role.descr: To whom, what does it have import?

example.name: Arg 1
example.text: All the Democrats in the house could take a year - long vacation and the results would largely be the same , so Giffords 's absence from her duties is hardly consequential .

example.name: All args
example.text: The way the issue is framed is not consequential to the agenda-setting hypothesis.
example.arg: The way the issue is framed

roleset.name: punish
roleset.note: CONSEQUENCE-V NOTES: Added by Julia for earthquakes.

example.name: consequence-v
example.text: Today his teacher consequenced him for "sitting there for 20 minutes, choosing not to do his work."
example.arg: for sitting there for 20 minutes, choosing not to do his work

example.name: consequence-n
example.text: Donald Trump has warned US citizens that there will be 'consequences' for leaving the country on vacation.
example.arg: for leaving the country on vacation

roleset.name: result
roleset.note: CONSEQUENCE-V NOTES: Added by Julia for earthquakes.

example.name: in_consequence-m
example.text: But in that case the actual vacancy of the throne-arose from the incapacity of a King to govern in consequence of expulsion for his crimes
example.arg: the incapacity of a King to govern

example.name: consequence
example.text: The consequence of this misuse of the term "curate" was that the title of "perpetual curate" fell into desuetude in the Anglican Church
example.arg: of this misuse of the term "curate"
